title: Hiding the HUD in replays
body:
Hi there, 
just wanted to ask if it's possible to hide the whole HUD in the new implemented replay system.
And if so, how do you do it?

Thanks in advance

replies.body:
You can hide most of the HUD by hitting the **A** key while in a replay. Additionally, you can click the *eye* icon in the bottom left and select which parts of the HUD you'd like to hide by unchecking the boxes for the specific elements you don't want.

Let me know if this helped! ^.^
Yeah but i wanted to hide everything and that doesnt seem to be possible with the official league replay system..

It's a brand new feature, so it's very likely there will be some changes to it over time. For now, though, this is what we have to work with.

If you have any other questions, let me know.

there actually is a button in the replay menu which says " hide ui " you just need to put a hotkey in cause its empty.

then it will hide EVERYTHING expect the curser :D

Logging in just to upvote and say thank you for this! I'm looking into making self-edited montages and this is EXTREMELY useful for capturing good footage to use in the montage. Really glad I don't have to use some sort of third party program. Thanks again :D.

You can hide EVERYTHING. if you are in the replay, there is the replay menu next to the minimap on the left.

If you click it, you get the hotkey menu for the replay system.

Then on the bottom there is a section " hide ui " and it was empty, so you need to put a key in. 

It hides everything, you can move your mouse to the bottom or top and you wont see anything in the ui etc. So a perfect clear picture :)
